result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:48 AM Defendant Aaron Lee Michael Erickson in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Aaron Lee Michael Erickson.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State calls Taavi Mattison, sworn and testifies
Patrol Officer City of Superior Police Department for the last 4.5 years.
On duty 10/10/22 responded to a domestic call at 905 N 22nd Street Superior WI Douglas County.
Witness identifies defendant
Attorney has no response
Record reflects identification of defendant

Attorney Hoffman cross examines witness

State requests to screen share proposed exhibit 1-certified copy of bond sheet Douglas County Case 22CF297-O-R
State requesting the court to take judicial notice that the defendant has an open criminal matter 22CF297 and was pending on the date of the incident.
Court takes judicial notice 

State final comments
Defense final comments

Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for arraignment. Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:27 PM Defendant Aaron Lee Michael Erickson appeared by video with Attorney Michael Hoffman.  Attorney Peter Kruger appears for the State of Wisconsin in person.
Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Defendant's address updated and amended on complaint 105 N 22nd Street, Duluth MN 55806. Not guilty plea(s) entered. Attorney requests preliminary hearing. 
State requesting 750cb No contact with MS or 905 N 22nd st.
State reviews criminal history, prior fta, pending methamphetamine case. MN history no information on fta's on those cases.
Attorney indicates 13 year douglas county resident, family ties.
Defendant indicates unemployed, falling behind in child support, house in foreclosure; has no money to pay for any kind of bail.
Attorney notes made voluntary appearance the next day after fta. No ability to post.
Court orders $500cb and $2000sb- No contact with MS or 905 N 22nd St Superior WI.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:45 am.
